jcr:content.jcr:title: Queensland Maritime Defence Force Auxiliary Gunboats

contentheadline.headline: Queensland Maritime Defence Force Auxiliary Gunboats

contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[File:State Library of Queensland 39016 HMQS Bonito 1890.png|300px]] |Ship caption=''Bonito'' in 1896 }} {{Infobox Ship Class Overview |Name= Queensland auxiliary gunboats |Builders= [[EDI Rail#History|Walkers]] of [[Maryborough, Queensland|Maryborough]] |Operators= [[Image:Flag of Queensland.svg|25px|Flag of Queensland]] Queensland and Australia |Class before= None |Class after= None |Subclasses= |Cost= |Built range= 1884–1885 |In service range= 1884 – at least 1901 |In commission range= 1884 – at least 1901 |Total ships building= |Total ships planned= |Total ships completed=5 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active=0 |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired=5 |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= |Ship type= |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement=450 tons |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length= |Ship beam= |Ship height= |Ship draught= |Ship draft= |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship ice class= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion=Expansion steam engines |Ship speed= |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed= |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement= |Ship crew= |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= *1 × [[BL 5 inch gun Mk I - V|BL {{convert|5|in|mm|sing=on|sigfig=3}} gun]] Except ''Benito'': *1 × 64-pounder gun |Ship armour= |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} After the formation of the [[Colonial navies of Australia#Queensland|Queensland Maritime Defence Force]] in 1884, the colonial government purchased two gunboats and a torpedo boat to equip the new force.{{sfn|Gillett|1977|p=105}} However, given the number of ports along the Queensland coast it was realised that additional ships were required. Five ships had already been ordered for the Queensland Department of Harbours and Rivers when the decision was taken to convert them to also serve as auxiliary gunboats. This resulted in the fitting of a 5-inch gun and the relocation of the boilers below the waterline.The ships were as follows: ''Bonito'', ''Bream'', ''Dolphin'', ''Pumba'', and ''Stingaree''.{{sfn|Gillett|1977|p=110}} Steam-propelled twin screwed "hopper barges",{{sfn|Pixley|1972|p=18}} these ships were built by [[EDI Rail#History|Walkers]] at [[Maryborough, Queensland|Maryborough]] and, at 450 tons, they were the largest warships built in the Australian colonies before [[Federation of Australia|Federation]]. The [[Depression (economics)|depression]] of the 1890s greatly curtailed operations with most of the vessels placed in reserve and being used as training vessles. ''Stingaree'' served until 1895 whilst ''Pumba'' remained on strength at the time of Federation in 1901, before being sold to Pioneer Gravels (Queensland). She was rebuilt in 1958 and renamed ''Enterprise'', serving as a cargo vessel beyond the late 1970s.{{sfn|Gillett|1977|p=110}} ''Bream'' (1963), ''Dolphin'' (1963) and ''Stingaree'' (1966) were sunk off [[Tangalooma]], [[Moreton Bay]].{{sfn|Diving the Gold Coast| |p=}} == See also == *[[List of Queensland Maritime Defence Force ships]] *[[Colonial navies of Australia#Queensland|Colonial navies of Australia – Queensland]] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} == References == *{{cite web |url=http://www.divingthegoldcoast.com.au/index.asp?PageID=divesite&DiveSite=tangalooma |title=Diving the Gold Coast |publisher= |author=Banks, Ian |accessdate=31 May 2013 |ref=CITEREFDiving the Gold Coast}} *{{cite book |title=Warships of Australia|year=1977| last=Gillett |first=Ross |publisher=Rigby |location=Adelaide, South Australia |isbn= 0-7270-0472-7|ref=harv}} *{{cite book |last=Pixley |first=Norman |title=Quensland—Harbours, Rivers and Marine |year=1972 |url=http://espace.library.uq.edu.au/eserv/UQ:210083/s00855804_1972_1973_9_4_9.pdf |publisher=Royal Historical Society of Queensland |oclc= |ref=harv}} {{Queensland Maritime Defence Force Auxiliary Gunboats}} [[Category:Queensland Maritime Defence Force Auxiliary Gunboats| ]] [[Category:Gunboat classes]]
